name: tissue 0
description: Digest tissue in 10 mL of lysis buffer.

name: tissue 1
description: Step 1: Place tissue in 50 mL conical tube in 10 mL of Lysis Buffer with 100 ul proteinase K \(1:100 dilution of a 20mg/ml).

name: tissue 2
description: Homogenize solution using the TissueMeiser, takes about 15-45 seconds depending on amount of tissue.

name: TissueMeiser 0
description: Between every sample, sterilize TissueMeiser in water, followed by bleach, followed by 70% EtOH followed by PBS.

name: water 0
description: Change water after every sample, other wash liquids can be used for 3-4 samples.

name: tissue 4
description: This can be done in a water bath or incubator.

name: cell lysate 0
description: Take 500ul of the cell lysate from above digestion.

name: cell lysate 1
description: \(Make sure to mix well before taking the 500ul…VORTEX)

name: cell lysate 4
description: Add 500ul phenol/chloroform/IAA \(if it is red use another bottle)

name: cell lysate 6
description: Withdraw top layer, don’t be greedy \(~400ul)

name: cell lysate 9
description: Transfer aqueous top layer \(really don’t be greedy) to 2.5 vol 100% ethanol \(1.25ml) 1/30 vol 3M Sodium Acetate pH5.2

name: cell lysate 13
description: Spin 30 seconds at 13000rpm decant, withdraw all liquid, do not air dry too much.

name: cell lysate 13 1 1
description: Split into 8 individual wells of an 8-strip PCR tube, spin down.

name: cell lysate 13 1 1 2
description: Pool PCR reactions back to 800ul volume

name: PCR product 0
description: Run out 100 ul of your PCR product on a 5% agarose gel.

name: PCR product 1
description: Gel extract product using the Qiagen MinElute Gel Purification Kit; Elute in 25 ul H20.

name: PCR product 1 1
description: Send samples for BioAnalyzer QC DNA 1000 assay to obtain molar concentration

name: cell lysate 13 1 1 2 2
description: You will have to decide how you want to pool your libraries.

name: cell lysate 13 1 1 2 1 1
description: You could pool 1:1:1…:1, you could also pool based on tissue weight, etc.
